citations.narrative:
One of the areas in the facility that allows feeding and contact with cattle did not have an attendant present during the
inspection on 7/17 and 7/18. Inspectors observed members of the public touching the heads and horns of cattle, petting
animals through the fence, and feeding the cattle. Lack of a knowledgeable and readily identifiable attendant does not
ensure the safety of the animals and safety of the public. A responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable
employee/attendant must be present at all times during periods of public contact with animals.
***Facility had an attendant present on 7/21 for remainder of inspection, and the facility was closed to the public on 7/22.
***Maintain correct from 7/23/2025 going forward.

The facility had not maintained a giraffe's exercise yard in good repair to protect it from injury at the time of inspection.
The giraffe had a healing leg wound that was under veterinary care. The facility representative reported he had hit on a
panel when exercising under direct supervision. The panel area that he hit had been repaired prior to inspection; however,
inspectors identified additional areas with rough/sharp edges that the giraffe could have had access to when exercised.
The facility began making repairs on all these areas prior to the inspection exit interview. Enclosures must be maintained
free of sharp edges and points since edges and points can cause injury to the animals. Ensure that the giraffe exercise
yard is maintained in a manner that protects him from injury.
***Correct by 7/26/2025, and prior to his re-introduction to the exercise yard.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
Additional Inspectors:
SCOTT WELCH, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
2.131(d)(2) 
   
Handling of animals. 
One of the areas in the facility that allows feeding and contact with cattle did not have an attendant present during the 
inspection on 7/17 and 7/18. Inspectors observed members of the public touching the heads and horns of cattle, petting 
animals through the fence, and feeding the cattle. Lack of a knowledgeable and readily identifiable attendant does not 
ensure the safety of the animals and safety of the public. A responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable 
employee/attendant must be present at all times during periods of public contact with animals.  
***Facility had an attendant present on 7/21 for remainder of inspection, and the facility was closed to the public on 7/22.  
***Maintain correct from 7/23/2025 going forward. 
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The facility had not maintained a giraffe's exercise yard in good repair to protect it from injury at the time of inspection. 
The giraffe had a healing leg wound that was under veterinary care. The facility representative reported he had hit on a 
panel when exercising under direct supervision. The panel area that he hit had been repaired prior to inspection; however, 
inspectors identified additional areas with rough/sharp edges that the giraffe could have had access to when exercised. 
The facility began making repairs on all these areas prior to the inspection exit interview. Enclosures must be maintained 
free of sharp edges and points since edges and points can cause injury to the animals. Ensure that the giraffe exercise 
yard is maintained in a manner that protects him from injury.  
***Correct by 7/26/2025, and prior to his re-introduction to the exercise yard. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
SCOTT WELCH, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
